An agent hid a secret message with RSA, but mistakenly used a modulus made from two Blum primes. Can you uncover the flag? Cipher: 10238313045064728433171161863283202718843697022848972426017660404323870504825811225852006455928025989994228421092324552032458703385142620767572131688730437

The flag format is flag{...}
n=12072853448957740883967034403070101453988866427941551209652626307729567382763643729214144302196926994777290540144249544665316178908114483320012804338233993, e=1782364335386096709435884412476317083160366622812847132664934358292764121093503704177177014443752917989638649520573358442644370097322865037219063353614181
The lower 104 bits of p are: 16706083744461303627662281434822196019


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{5ilx9ryf}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 10238313045064728433171161863283202718843697022848972426017660404323870504825811225852006455928025989994228421092324552032458703385142620767572131688730437
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=12072853448957740883967034403070101453988866427941551209652626307729567382763643729214144302196926994777290540144249544665316178908114483320012804338233993, e=1782364335386096709435884412476317083160366622812847132664934358292764121093503704177177014443752917989638649520573358442644370097322865037219063353614181
The lower 104 bits of p are: 16706083744461303627662281434822196019

extra_info: p=115154384639204453079254522416405690267546119245642060412097030192265629645619, q=104840588456824795128209242544386875655604362529184849728921703922856109112147, Ï†(n)=12072853448957740883967034403070101453988866427941551209652626307729567382763423734241048272948719531012329747578326394183541351997973464585897682599476228
